timeline.message:
[JENKINS-64039] improve CaseInsensitive.equals(String, String) performance

The CaseInsensitive IdStrategy would always do a full string comparison
even when all that was required was an equivallence check.

updated the javadoc to clarify performance implications for subclasses
and fix the performance of the CaseInsensitive strategy

(cherry picked from commit 2cd33a184f3b75a5c1d408abd3f62c9e792fed76)

[JENKINS-64035] - Winstone 5.12: Update Jetty from 9.4.30.v20200611 to 9.4.33.v20201020

(cherry picked from commit 0f998f300d896802985cabd78626629fa2158a52)

[JENKINS-63868] - Prevent the Build History Widget from exploding when user have Discover permissions without Read for folders

(cherry picked from commit 7ccf1ba04062ef268578e4ca7e0fab576421ab0e)

Merge pull request #5010 from jeffret-b/jenkinsAgentJnlp

[JENKINS-35452] A step towards removing more 'slave' terminology.

(cherry picked from commit 7b952de6c606bb5bafc1d7d4cbf09b84fb016b54)

[JENKINS-64040, JENKINS-64136] Fix hidden page elements from radio blocks showing up when they shouldn't (#5046)

(cherry picked from commit ffe0fa8a53a10572ca555ae61fb6a720da7ff4cb)

timeline.bodyText: Why are we backporting a cosmetic change that touches security-sensitive code? This feels like an unnecessary risk.
timeline.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: Well, It is that risk vs. terminology fix postponed by 12 weeks. The change seems safe to me. Any other thoughts?
replies.author: olivergondza

replies.bodyText: seems fine to me to backport
replies.author: timja

replies.bodyText: Not a great backport for the same reasons I listed in #5010 (review)
replies.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText:
terminology fix postponed by 12 weeks

I think a terminology fix can wait.
replies.author: jglick

timeline.message:
Update the pinned version of ATH in use to a more recent version (#5064)

Revert "Merge pull request #5010 from jeffret-b/jenkinsAgentJnlp"

This reverts commit 31cf45c294a78e60c9600c3c9868db4a58ea37b0.

JDK 11.0.9 / 8.0.272+ compatible FunctionsTest#printThrowable() (#5033)

* JDK 11.0.9 / 8.0.272+ FunctionsTest#printThrowable()

* Ensure proper older java 11 backwards compatibility
